trial_identification.studytitle: Acne Education: Designing and developing resources relevant to acne sufferers today; and investigating the level of acne knowledge amongst medical and pharmacy students.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A study of acne knowledge in the general and medical/pharmacy student communities with the outcome of being able to better target and design acne information resources.

interventions.interventions: This study will survey populations to determine the existing level of knowledge about acne with a view to developing relevant patient resources. The surveys will be available for completion over a period of approximately four months (June-October 2008), although each participant will only be required to complete the survey once.

primaryOutcome.outcome: To profile the demographics and level of acne knowledge of persons seeking acne information on a specified website.
To profile the level of acne knowledge amongst medical and pharmacy students at Australian universities

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Analyse data from website survey to allow targeting and planning of an effective acne information resource for the general public
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Data analysis complete by end October 2008

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Persons of any age and sex who EITHER: - Access the 'All About Acne' website and click the link to the survey OR - Are enrolled in an undergraduate or postgraduate Medicine or Pharmacy degree whose university agrees to distribute invitations to participate in the study; and who access the link contained in this invitation.

sponsorship.primarysponsorname: All About Acne resource (All ABout Acne will support this project for funds for technology however, all people hours worked are for free)
